meanings.definition: The act of clarifying or making something clear.
meanings.sent1: The eclaircissement of the instructions helped me understand the task better.
meanings.sent2: Her eclaircissement of the concept made it easier for everyone to grasp.
meanings.sent3: During the meeting, his eclaircissement of the issue brought a sense of relief.
meanings.sent4: The eclaircissement of the mystery revealed the true culprit.
meanings.sent5: The eclaircissement of the foggy situation was like a light shining through darkness.

meanings.sent1: The teacher's eclaircissement of the math problem helped the students solve it.
meanings.sent2: Please provide an eclaircissement for your absence from the meeting.
meanings.sent3: His eclaircissement of why he was late was surprisingly amusing.
meanings.sent4: The eclaircissement of the joke made everyone burst into laughter.
meanings.sent5: Her eclaircissement of the story added depth and understanding to the plot.
